Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed (fired greenish brown); from outside: part of lotus flower in added white and red; frieze of white dots between two wide white bands (only traces remaining); frieze of tongues alternating red and void lined in white; white zigzag pattern; exterior: band of billets and squares below zone with part of large rosette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Lemos no. 1081 from Cyprus and British Museum 1924,1201.587 and 1924,1201.589. Lemos mentions an indiscernible object on the exterior surface of the phiale which she does not describe. The only visible decoration on the exterior are the rosette and band.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, no. 1221, pl. 159)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2020) (phase 2)
